dmca.title: NOTICE of COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT
dmca.body:
1. INFRINGING SITES: Please indicate the infringing websites and the specific
URLs and or jpegs where the infringements are located. Attach additional pages if
necessary.
Infringing Websites Specific URL or Other Identification of the
Infringing Materials.
www.whathefrank.co.uk Duplicate site of our material
Plus this is a direct attempt to anchor related
sites to misinform and promote suicide, which is
of course the complete opposite of our own
campaign.
2. COPYRIGHTED (ORIGINAL)MATERIAL:
Location of Copyrighted material
(Website, magazine name, etc.)
Specific Identification of Copyrighted Material
(Exact URL of website, magazine volume and page, etc.)
www.whatthefrank.co.uk Original Official Website content


------------------------
NOTE FROM RECIPIENT:
You can file this one under R for Ridiculous. The site was based
on their works, yes; but was modified enough to count as an original
work in my opinion, and was (fairly) clearly labeled as a parody site.
The really ridiculous thing is that both myself, and the guy leveling
this accusation, are both residents of the UK, and on top of that, the
site was intended to parody the organisation of an event scheduled to
happen on the 31st, and so the notice to take the site down 24 hours after the notice was recieved was complied with, as I was going to take the site down after it was no longer needed anyway.
It is worrying to see how the effects of the DMCA are curtailing free speech in other parts of the world.
dmca.sender_name: CWIE, LLC, 2353 W. University Dr, Tempe, AZ 85281
